text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen 
my mom doesn't cook very much but when she

does she's got some very good ideas one day 
she made roasted pork tenderloin with honey

and soy marinade and I was hooked over the years 
I've modified her recipe a little bit and today

I'm gonna share it with you let's get started 
my mom never quite named this dish but I have

named it moo ob nampeung moo is pork ob is to bake 
or to roast and nampeung is honey let's start with

the marinade the most important ingredient is 
of course honey this honey is actually a local

honey harvested by my friend who's a beekeeper 
and keeps a hive in the middle of Vancouver

some soy sauce soy and honey go together so 
well golden mountain sauce you can just use

more soy sauce but Golden mountain sauce just 
has a slightly different flavor bottle looks

like that a little bit of tartness to right in 
everything up some tamarind I'm going to add

another source of acid now my mom used ketchup 
but I prefer using Fiera chive you can get the

original Thai Syrah even better little spiciness 
as well to add a little bit of richness to this

marinade which is also going to be the sauce 
from coconut milk some white pepper a little

subtle heat and I'm going to microplane this 
garlic you can also just mince it with a knife

that's the marinade let's deal with the pork 
pork tenderloin it's lean but it's tender I

love it for roasting and baking remove all this 
silver skin because the silver skin is tough

I'm going to cut this into two pieces horizontally 
so it's spinner makes bite-sized pieces and it'll

cook faster and just with the fork I'm going to 
poke some holes in the pork so that the marinade

really penetrate it's kind of fun in goes also 
our bonus pieces and the marinade get out as

much air as you can and just give it a massage 
there that goes into the fridge for at least

two hours even better overnight so the park is 
ready to go now when my mom made this she used

to bake the whole tenderloin in a small tabletop 
oven that we had because in Thailand most homes

don't have a built-in oven like this but today 
I am going to use the broiler function because

I discovered that if I cut the pork tenderloin in 
half like we did the broiler works really well and

it's super fast to the marinade is going to get 
turned into a sauce oh forgot my bonus pieces

so about five minutes on high or just 
until the tops are nice and brown

there it is if you want to use a meat thermometer 
the temperature you're going for is 145 Fahrenheit

pull it out at maybe 140 and then it'll continue 
to climb to 145 it is okay for pork to still be

slightly pink in the middle now this has to rest 
and so while it's resting let's make the sauce so

the sauce is basically the marinade which we have 
to cook because it's had pork in it I'm going to

add a little bit of black soy sauce which isn't 
very salty just give some nice dark brown color

this is so flexible now you can taste it and make 
it more sweet more salty more [ __ ] more spicy

whatever you want now make sure you bring it to 
a boil before you taste it okay because remember

this had pork sitting in it mmm well that's good a 
little bit more honey I like that balance but it's

a little strong so I'm just going to go in with 
a splash of water the pork is ready the sauce is

ready let's put it all together I've got a long 
slicing knife which comes in really handy and

just thin thin pieces look how juicy that is and 
that's a benefit of having such a watery marinade

some of the water from the marinade went in 
and became sort of a brine for the pork you

can have the pork in the sauce just on rice which 
is what we normally did or you can make it into

a noodle dish so I've got some egg noodles that 
I boiled and some bok choy which I blanched and

I tossed the noodles with some garlic oil 
made it super garlicky and now the sauce

sweet salty the pork is perfectly tender mmm my 
mom's gonna be so happy I think this I hope this

dish makes it on your table one of these days and 
makes your family happy the way did my family and

when that happens let me know how it goes send me 
a photo Facebook Twitter or Instagram and recipe

is on etiquette ENCOM and i will see you next time 
for your next delicious time before we marinate I

am going to poke the pork with the fork I'm going 
to poke the bark I just do it now I am going to

poke the pork with the fork I'm going to poke the 
pork with the fork so the marinade can penetrate
